other_tests.findings: Acute and chronic hepatitis with scattered epithelioid granulomas and mild fatty changes; no acid-fast bacilli or fungi were seen.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Finding of hepatic granulomas suggested a number of diseases, and subsequent bone marrow biopsy revealed scattered epithelioid and giant-cell granulomas.

other_tests.findings: Scattered epithelioid and giant-cell granulomas; no malignant cells were seen.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Fibrin-ring granulomas were identified, which are usually associated with Q fever.

other_tests.procedure_name: Serologic Testing for C. burnetii (Q fever)
other_tests.date: Five days after bone marrow biopsy
other_tests.findings: Antibody titers to C. burnetii were strongly positive (IgG phase 1, 1:16; IgG phase 2, 1:1024; IgM phase 1, 1:1024; and IgM phase 2, 1:256).
